program.name: x11-ssh-askpass
program.build:
gmake includes gmake
# fix path in man page # use $SHELL to work around strange problem with /bin/sh on Tru64 ${SHELL} \ ${SB_VAR_GROFF}/bin/gnroff -mandoc x11-ssh-askpass.man >x11-ssh-askpass.cat
program.install:
gmake install INSTALL=${SB_PATH_INSTALL}
${SB_PATH_INSTALL} -m 755 -o root -g 0 -d ${SB_INSTALL_PREFIX}/man/cat1 ${SB_PATH_INSTALL} -m 644 -o root -g 0 x11-ssh-askpass.cat \ ${SB_INSTALL_PREFIX}/man/cat1/x11-ssh-askpass.1

note.para: The x11-ssh-askpass program is not meant to be invoked directly, but by ssh-add(1). From the ssh-add(1) man page:
note.screen: If ssh-add needs a passphrase, it will read the passphrase from the current terminal if it was run from a terminal. If ssh-add does not have a terminal associated with it but DISPLAY and SSH_ASKPASS are set, it will execute the program specified by SSH_ASKPASS and open an X11 window to read the passphrase. This is particularly useful when calling ssh-add from a .Xsession or related script. (Note that on some machines it may be necessary to redirect the input from /dev/null to make this work.)

item.para: Work around strange problem with /bin/sh on Tru64
